dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Mag 7 Earnings & DeepSeek: What Should Investors Know?
News Content: DeekSeek appears to have put a big dent in what everyone believed was a source of competitive advantage in the AI race for Tech leaders like Microsoft MSFT, Alphabet GOOGL, Amazon AMZN, and others. And if we go by how Microsoft and Meta described the evolving AI competitive landscape on their respective Q4 earnings calls last week, we will most likely hear comparable commentary from Amazon and Alphabet as they come out with their December-quarter results this week.

Market participants have all along been skeptical of the investment case for the extraordinarily heavy spending by Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, and others on AI-centric data centers and related infrastructure. The issue all along has been these companies’ inability to articulate a clear case for how these investments will get monetized.

While a lot about DeepSeek’s actual cost in building and training its model is unknown, notwithstanding the announced figure of a few million dollars, the hundreds of billions of dollars that these companies are collectively pouring into the project appears to be overkill. Microsoft and Meta reiterated their spending plans and see the resulting data center capacity as giving them a strategic advantage in the long run. We can safely assume that Amazon and Alphabet will follow Microsoft and Meta on this crucial question.

While the market’s collective focus was mainly on the AI question for Microsoft and Meta, the former disappointed in its core results, with cloud guidance coming up short, while the latter showed plenty of operating momentum in operating results. Microsoft’s December-quarter earnings were up +10.2% from the same period last year on +12.3% higher revenues, while Meta’s earnings and revenues increased +48.7% and +20.6% from the year-earlier levels, respectively.

Apple and Tesla, the other Mag 7 players that also reported results last week, received favorable market reception. However, the positive market follow-through was likely less of a response to the core results and more of a sigh of relief at better-than-feared numbers.

China has emerged as a major risk in the Apple story, with tepid iPhone demand in that key market and the company’s continuing AI struggles taking center stage. Some anecdotal evidence suggests that some of Apple’s local Chinese competitors are giving it a lot tougher competition than in years past. On top of that is the prospect of tariffs, a far bigger issue for Apple than the rest of its Mag 7 peers.

Apple’s December-quarter earnings were up +7.1% on +4% higher revenues, while Tesla’s earnings and revenues for the period were up +15.7% and +2.1% from the year-earlier level, respectively. Net margins were up at Apple and Tesla, with Apple’s margins up 86 basis points from the same period last year while Tesla’s expanded 105 bps.

繼續閱讀

Take a look at the chart below that shows current consensus expectations for the ‘Mag 7’ stocks as a whole for the current and coming periods in the context of what they were able to achieve in the preceding period. The +25.6% earnings growth comprises actual results from the four group members that have reported and estimates for Alphabet, Amazon, and Nvidia (that haven’t reported yet).Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The chart below that shows the group’s earnings and revenue growth on an annual basis.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Beyond these Mag 7 players, total Q4 earnings for the Technology sector as a whole are expected to be up +19.2% from the same period last year on +10.8% higher revenues.

The chart below shows the sector’s Q4 earnings and revenue growth expectations in the context of where growth has been in recent quarters and what is expected in the coming three periods.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The chart below shows the sector’s growth picture on an annual basis.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The Tech sector has enjoyed a favorable revisions trend for the last few quarters, with the Mag 7 stocks in the fore front of the rising estimates trend. The +16.9% earnings growth expected for the sector for 2025 at present is up from the +15.8% growth expected three months back.

Q4 Earnings Season Scorecard

Through Friday, January 31st, we have seen Q4 results from 179 S&P 500 members, or 35.8% of the index’s total membership. Total earnings for these companies are up +7.4% from the same period last year on +5.1% higher revenues, with 80.4% beating EPS estimates and 67% beating revenue estimates.

The comparison charts below put the Q4 earnings and revenue growth rates relative to other recent periods for the same group of index members.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The comparison charts below put the Q4 EPS and revenue beats percentages relative to other recent periods for the same group of companies.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Key Earnings Reports This Week

The 132 S&P 500 members on deck to report results this week include several blue-chip operators like Pfizer, Pepsi, Ford, and others, in addition to the aforementioned Mag 7 players (Amazon and Alphabet).

By the end of this week, we will have seen Q4 results from more than 63% of the index’s total membership.

The Earnings Big Picture

The chart below shows the Q4 earnings and revenue growth expectations in the context of where growth has been in the preceding four quarters and what is expected in the coming four quarters.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Excluding the contribution from the Mag 7 companies, S&P 500 earnings would have been up +5.6% on +4.1% higher revenues.

The chart below shows the overall earnings picture on a calendar-year basis, with double-digit earnings growth expected in 2025 and 2026.Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Please note that the very strong growth expected in 2025 is not driven by one or two sectors but is rather broad-based. All 16 Zacks sectors are expected to enjoy positive earnings growth in 2025, with 8 of the 16 Zacks sectors expected to achieve double-digit earnings growth.

For a detailed look at the overall earnings picture, including expectations for the coming periods, please check out our weekly Earnings Trends report >>>> Broad Based Sector Growth Expected for 2025

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights mixed sentiments regarding Apple's performance amidst competitive pressures, particularly from Chinese competitors and concerns over AI investments. While Apple reported a modest earnings increase, the overall market reaction to the Mag 7 earnings suggests a cautious outlook. The mention of tepid iPhone demand in China and potential tariffs adds to the uncertainty. Given these factors, the probability of a stock price rise is tempered by the competitive landscape and market skepticism, leading to a higher probability of a price fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While Q4 earnings were up, the market reception was lukewarm, described as a "sigh of relief" rather than strong endorsement. The major concern is China, with tepid iPhone demand and increased competition. The potential for tariffs poses a significant risk. The news also highlights the broader tech sector's AI spending and the market's skepticism about monetization, which could indirectly affect Apple's valuation. Considering these factors, the negative aspects outweigh the positives, suggesting a higher probability of a stock price fall.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While Apple's Q4 earnings beat expectations and received favorable market reception, this was attributed more to relief than strong performance.  Concerns remain about tepid iPhone demand in China, increased competition, and the potential impact of tariffs.  The article highlights the significant AI investments by other tech giants (Microsoft, Alphabet, Amazon, Meta), questioning their monetization strategy and suggesting Apple's AI struggles are a significant headwind.  The overall positive sentiment in the tech sector and the broader S&P 500 earnings season might offer some support to Apple's stock price. However, the specific challenges faced by Apple in China and its AI development outweigh the general positive market trends in this context. Therefore, the probability of a price fall is considered slightly higher than a price rise.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news highlights several key points affecting Apple Inc. (AAPL). Firstly, Apple's earnings and revenues for the December quarter showed modest growth (+7.1% and +4% respectively), with net margins improving by 86 basis points. However, the company faces significant challenges in China, including tepid iPhone demand and increased competition from local players. Additionally, Apple's struggles in AI and potential tariffs are noted as risks. While the market reacted favorably to Apple's better-than-feared results, the underlying issues in China and AI could weigh on investor sentiment. The broader context of the 'Mag 7' earnings shows mixed performance, with some peers like Meta outperforming while others like Microsoft disappointed in certain areas. Given these factors, the stock price movement is likely to be influenced by a combination of relief from the earnings report and concerns over future growth prospects.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article discusses the recent earnings reports of the 'Mag 7' companies, including Apple, and the impact of DeepSeek on the AI competitive landscape. While Apple's December-quarter earnings were up 7.1% on 4% higher revenues, the company faces risks such as tepid iPhone demand in China and AI struggles. The article also mentions that the market's focus was on the AI question for Microsoft and Meta, and that Apple and Tesla received favorable market reception despite some concerns. Given the mixed signals and the fact that the positive market follow-through was likely a sigh of relief at better-than-feared numbers, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is slightly lower than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news highlights mixed signals for Apple Inc. (AAPL). While Apple's earnings showed moderate growth, there are concerns regarding China's market performance and ongoing AI struggles. The market might react positively if Apple provides reassurance about addressing these issues, but negative sentiment could persist if no significant improvement is indicated.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json

  "reasoning": "The consistent trend across previous predictions indicates a higher probability of Apple's stock price falling. This is primarily driven by concerns surrounding tepid iPhone demand in China, increased competition from local players, Apple's struggles in AI, and the potential impact of tariffs. While Apple's earnings showed modest growth, the market reaction was lukewarm, suggesting underlying anxieties. The broader tech sector's performance is mixed, and the skepticism surrounding AI investments further contributes to the negative sentiment. Considering these factors and the consensus from previous rounds, the probability of a stock price fall remains elevated.",
```
